cards.flavor: Every journey starts with a small splash.
cards.name: A Journey Begins
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a permanent card with mana value 3 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a permanent card with mana value 3 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: ...while the moments start to linger...
cards.name: Abandoned Monument
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color. If you control another nonbasic land, Abandoned Monument doesn't untap at the beginning of your next untap step.
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. If you control another nonbasic land, Abandoned Monument doesn't untap at the beginning of your next untap step.

cards.flavor: The law's arm was long, but Eli's gang's arm was longer — for a time, at least.
cards.name: Agent of Long Shadows
cards.originalText:
Deception {2}{B}
Whenever Agent of Long Shadows deals combat damage to a player, you may put a Rogue card from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
Valery stood, a mad gleam in her eye. “Come on.” She said. “We're going to rob the Devil blind.”
—Azamir, “The Thief of Life”
cards.name: Ambitious Necromancer
cards.originalText: Sabotage — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If an opponent or permanent is chosen multiple times as a target for a single spell or ability, (for example, an escalated Isolation), the sabotage ability will only trigger once for that player or permanent. If different opponents or permanents are being targeted, the sabotage ability will trigger for each one.

cards.text: Sabotage — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Artian, Phyrexian Architect
cards.originalText:
When Artian, Phyrexian Architect enters the battlefield, search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a corruption counter on a land you control. Then create a 1/1 colorless Phyrexian artifact creature token for each land you control with a corruption counter on it.

cards.name: Stickup
cards.originalText: Target opponent discards a card at random. If that card's mana value is 3 or less, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

rulings.text: You will cast the card after any triggers caused by discarding the card, but before they resolve. Notably, a card stolen with Stickup can't be cast for its madness cost.

cards.flavor: Through hardship and bloodshed, the Rakkiri lands were kept safe and sound.
cards.name: Worthy Vulpine
cards.originalText: When this permanent transforms into Worthy Vulpine or at the beginning of combat on your turn, creatures you control gain haste and trample until end of turn.
